documents.title: domesday book : in good company
text: when the domesday book comes to the castle this summer it 'll take pride of place next to one of the four remaining copies of the magna carta in the specially designed vault .
it cost millions to build and was finished back in 2014 as part of extensive works to renovate the castle .
it 's had its issues in the past though , last year the magna carta had to be temporarily moved to a secret location because a fault with the roof meant the humidity levels were n't correct .
it 's all sorted now though so the national archives need not worry !
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: impvasion : great grandad in arsenal-beating team of 1915
text: i always knew that my great grandad andrew 'andy ' gardner had played for lincoln city .
it was something my late gran jean wheeler spoke about often .
she was extremely proud of her dad 's links to lincoln city and was an imps supporter herself .
she spoke fondly of watching her dad train and play for the team .
andy was born in scotland and played a couple of times for scotland and captained lincoln city .
it was n't until this week though that i realised he was part of the team that beat arsenal 1-0..
in the he is fifth from left , middle row .
here 's hoping history repeats itself this weekend .

documents.title: a1 reopens after fatal crash
text: the a1 near newark has reopened this morning following yesterday 's crash .
a 52-year-old man died in the six-vehicle collision which happened shortly before 08:00 .
another man , the driver of one of the lorries , was airlifted to hospital with serious injuries which police said were not believed to be life threatening .
a woman was also taken to hospital and three other men were treated at the scene for their injuries .
the road had originally been expected to reopen last night but investigations into the cause of the crash carried on through the night .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: queen unveils memorial partly made in lincolnshire
text: a memorial dedicated to those who served in the afghanistan and iraq wars has been unveiled by the queen in central london .
the sculpture by paul day also marks the contribution made by civilians in the conflicts .
it is formed of two stone monoliths and a bronze medallion .
its unveiling in victoria embankment gardens followed a service for 2,500 veterans on horse guards parade .
more than 800 uk military personnel and civilians died in the three wars .
part of the memorial was made in lincolnshire .
author: Martin Slack

documents.title: memorial with county connections to be unveiled by queen
text: a memorial dedicated to those who served in afghanistan and both iraq wars will be unveiled by the queen in central london later .

it is formed of two stone monoliths and a bronze medallion .

part of the memorial - which is made from portland stone - was cut by lincolnshire firm stamford stone .

documents.title: lincolnshire couple admit killing man
text: a lincolnshire couple have admitted killing a man at their home near skegness last year .
sean booth , 26 , and sarah booth , 37 , ( were due to stand trial for the murder of wayne baxter , from wainfleet , this week .
today they 've pleaded guilty to manslaughter on the grounds of loss of control and the plea was accepted by the prosecution .
mr baxter who was 44 , suffered multiple stab wounds during an incident at the booth 's home in croft last march .
the pair were remanded in custody and will be sentenced on monday .
for more on this story tap here .

these improvements will provide an up to date environment in which our staff can deliver the best care to those babies who need it . ''

documents.title: lincolnshire codeword campaign adopted in scotland
text: a lincolnshire codeword campaign to help people who feel unsafe while out on a date has now been adopted in aberdeen .
the campaign suggests that people go to bar staff and ask for angela if they need help out of an awkward or worrying situation .
the campaign was the brainchild of hayley childs , from lincolnshire county council , it has since gone viral .
it 's drawn support from across the world , including from hollywood star ashton kutcher .

BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: water supply problems continue on wolds

it 's the fourth day hundreds of residents have been left without a proper water supply .

documents.title: thriller moonwalking its way to lincolnshire
text: a west end musical based on the music of michael jackson is coming to lincolnshire .
thriller live is on a national tour and will be in skegness for six shows at the embassy theatre around hallowe'en .
the show is described as a `` two hour visual , audio and electrifying journey through the magic of michael 's 45 year musical history . ''
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: national war memorial made in lincolnshire
text: a war memorial commemorating soldiers who 've served in iraq , afghanistan and the gulf is to be unveiled tomorrow - .
and it 's been made by stonemasons in lincolnshire .
the memorial ( before it was finished ) was made by the stamford stone company .
they got the job because they 're one of the few companies with a stone-cutting machine big enough to create the huge blocks needed .
in the middle of the display there will be a giant bronze medallion .
the queen will unveil the memorial in london tomorrow .
we 're very proud to be associated with such an important memorial .
it was the ultimate bespoke job and a lovely thing to have done . ''
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: lincolnshire 's water-skiing champ
text: a young water-skier from lincolnshire is making waves across the world .
rob hazelwood from lincoln is following in his family 's footsteps in the sport .
the 17-year-old has recently been crowned the junior world champion at slalom and he gave me a demonstration :
when you 're a kid looking at all these amazing skiers recording these awesome scores you think am i ever going to get there ?
but to be at that point and compete at a high level is just fantastic . ''
author: Melvyn Prior
Presenter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: police search for missing scunthorpe woman
text: police are searching for a 31-year-old woman from scunthorpe who 's gone missing .
the family of hermione bryce-lane ( say they have n't heard from her in a fortnight .
police say they 're seriously concerned about her .
she 's described as about 5ft tall with shoulder length brown hair and of slim build .
she 's thought to be in the scunthorpe area but may have links with durham .
police want anyone with information to get in touch .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: wolds water supply : 'it 's the hygiene aspect that worries me '
text: hundreds of households in the wolds still have no water supply according to anglian water .
the supplier says there are still problems in tetford and hameringham .
repairs to a burst pipe running underneath the river bain have been particularly tricky .
we 've heard from tim in tetford , who says `` it 's getting beyond a joke '' :
anglian water have provided tankers to supply water directly into the pipes , so some areas should have running water :
bottled water is fine to a point , but that 's why we 've been prioritising putting water directly into the pipe networks so people can get it out of their taps and showers . ''
author: Scott Dalton
Presenter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: plans to build 122 houses on hospital site considered today
text: a row has broken out about this playing field in scunthorpe .
north lincolnshire council is considering plans today that campaigners say could lead to dozens of new houses being built here .
they want to build 122 homes on the former brumby hospital site but campaigners say it 'll include development on greenbelt land .
more than 1,000 people have signed a petition against the proposal .
author: Clare Crooks
BBC Local Live, Hull

documents.title: rail strike : northern publishes revised timetable
text: train operator northern has published details of its revised timetable which is due to operate during industrial action on monday 13 march .
the rmt union announced strike action last month in a dispute over plans to bring in more driver-only-operated trains .
northern says it expects to run approximately 980 services , or about 40 % of its normal timetable on many , but not all , of its routes in the north of england .
all services are expected to be extremely busy and the firm 's advising customers to give themselves extra time to travel and consider whether their journey is necessary .

richard allan , northern 's deputy managing director , says : `` we 've focused our planning efforts on maintaining a train service on our busier routes between 07:00 and 19:00 , and are looking to provide replacement bus services on some routes where trains wo n't run . ''

documents.title: lincoln city six points clear at top of national league
text: lincoln city beat braintree town to a 4 - 0 victory last night ; they 're now six points clear at the top of the national league .
lee angol ( who 's on loan from peterborough united , scored the winning goal .
fans may be more excited about their fa cup match at the emirates on saturday but last night 's win secures the teams top of the table position .
the team 's promotion hopes are seeming ever more likely , and the winning streak continues .
author: Rob Makepeace
BBC Radio Lincolnshire sport

documents.title: serco : we 're sorry schools are leaving us
text: a bit more on the news that schools finance firm serco has been docked another £ 1m in fines for poor performance by lincolnshire county council .
we 've heard from councillor kevin clarke - who 's a governor at sir francis hill school in lincoln .
he says the school wo n't use serco any more because of the problems .

serco 's issued a statement which says : `` we fully recognise our performance on this contract is not what it should be but we are continuing to make good progress , which was recognised at the council 's value for money committee last week .
`` we know there is still a lot more to be done and we remain determined to make this contract a success for lincolnshire .
`` serco supports 208 lincolnshire schools and the vast majority will remain with us over the coming year but we are very sorry to hear that this school feels it needs to leave the contract ''
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: mp 's anger after tory students ' social media account closed
text: the organisation that represents students at the university of lincoln has denied accusations of censorship .
lincoln 's mp has criticised the students ' union after it suspended the conservative society 's social media account .
karl mccartney has accused the union of being `` intolerant '' after questions were raised about its commitment to free speech .

but the union said in a statement : `` we can confirm that due to a suspected breach of the code of conduct a request has been made that the conservative society temporarily suspend their social media account . ''
author: Martin Slack
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: another £ 1m for travel scheme
text: a project which aims to promote healthier and more environmentally friendly travel has been awarded nearly £ 1m from the government .
it means the popular access lincoln scheme can continue until 2020 .
it 's already seen the setting up of a hire bike service in lincoln and improved rail stations in north hykeham and swinderby .

documents.title: former mp taverne : give public a new vote on europe
text: former lincoln mp lord taverne has lent his voice to calls for another referendum on brexit .
he 's been speaking during a debate in the house of lords today .
the government 's facing another defeat by the lords this evening over brexit .
peers are demanding a legal commitment that mps and peers are given a vote before the uk leaves the european union in two years ' time .
the liberal democrats want to go further and give the public another referendum on whether to leave , a move which lord taverne spoke in favour of .
a referendum is one way in which people would have a chance to change their mind ''
author: Martin Slack
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: justice minister : 'we are investing in prisons '
text: earlier we told you the grimsby mp melanie onn had claimed that prisoners 'were in charge of prisons ' .

the jusitice minister sam gyimah has responded to her concerns :

we do recognise by creating more staff and strengthening the frontline we will make it much easier for staff to challenge and support prisoners , which is why we 've announced new investment to recruit 2,500 new officers for our jails . ''

documents.title: school budget chaos firm docked another £ 1m
text: a private firm which runs school finances in lincolnshire has been told it 's having its payment docked by £ 1m .

documents.title: grimsby mp : 'prisoners are in control of prisons '
text: the grimsby mp has claimed inmates are in charge of jails across the country .
melanie onn raised the subject of an attack on one of her constituents at hmp lindholme during a discussion in parliament :
is n't it apparently and abundantly clear that the people who are in charge of our prisons are not governors and certainly not the secretary of state , it 's the prisoners ? ''

she 's up for the best actress in a musical for funny girl .
sheridan 's from epworth , between gainsborough and scunthorpe .

documents.title: council leader to step down due to ill health
text: it 's just been announced that marion brighton , the leader of sleaford-based north kesteven district council , is to step down due to ill-health .

documents.title: county 's budgens branches not on closure list
text: it 's been announced this morning that 34 branches of supermarket chain budgens are to close permanently - but lincolnshire 's branches are not on the list .
adminstrator pwc says some of the stores affected closed at the weekend and others will close over the next two weeks after a buyer could not be found for them .
there are branches of budgens in waddington , near lincoln , woodhall spa and bourne .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Lincolnshire Live

text: lincolnshire 's red arrows are flying with their smoke on today - and the blue skies above the county are the perfect canvas .
some early morning # smokeongo

documents.title: german demand for honour for dambuster johnny
text: britain 's last dambuster - george `` johnny '' johnson - should be honoured by the state , according to the head of the german dambusters museum .
the airman missed out on a new year honour - despite being nominated .
more than 300,000 people have now signed a petition calling for that to be rectified .
the squadron had been based at raf scampton
oliver koehler , from the dambusters museum in germany , said `` of course '' he should be honoured .
carol vorderman has also petitioned for him to be knighted .
mr koehler said mr johnson was `` courageous '' and had been `` ready at any time '' to `` risk his life '' and should be honoured .

documents.title: watch : machine that could solve wolds water problem
text: this is apparently a `` moleing machine '' .
anglian water say it will burrow under the ground to find a burst water main in the lincolnshire wolds .
about 200 homes are still affected by the burst , which first happened on sunday .
the machine 's needed because the main runs under the river bain and is difficult to reach using ordinary machinery .
hooray !
the big ''moleing ' machine 's being unloaded here in asterby ready to start work on fixing the broken water pipe !
author: BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: grass cutting cuts criticised
text: residents in skegness say parts of the town could become an `` eyesore '' if lincolnshire county council stops cutting the grass verges .
the authority says it 's had to cut back on grass cutting because of central government cuts .
town councillor mark anderson says leaving the grass uncut will damage the resort 's image , lead to a drop in visitors and a drop in tourist income .
the county council says it will work with skegness town council to find a solution .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: increase in 'mate crime ' incidents sparks concern
text: there 's a warning that dedicated criminal gangs are targeting vulnerable people in north lincolnshire online .
the nhs says there 's been a rise in so-called 'mate crime ' - where vulnerable people are befriended on social media and then actually abused or secretly stolen from .
a person is befriended over a period of time and almost groomed into feeling that the person really likes them and then they take advantage of that situation . ''
author: Martin Slack
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: intercepted aircraft : only crew on board
text: we were telling you earlier about the typhoon aircraft from raf coningsby which were sent to intercept a romanian jet in british airspace .
birmingham airport - where the plane landed - has now issued a statement about what happened .
the aircraft apparently suffered communication difficulties .

a spokesman said : `` we can confirm that a private saab 340 aircraft inbound from bucharest to birmingham and carrying three crew encountered communication difficulties during a flight earlier today .
`` in accordance with normal operating procedures the aircraft was intercepted by military jets on arrival into uk airspace and was escorted up to its scheduled arrival into birmingham . ''
author: Martin Slack
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: imps ' emirates date an official sell out
text: tickets have sold out for saturday 's fa cup quarter final match between lincoln city and arsenal .
the imps had almost 9,000 tickets on sale , which have sold in less than a week .
the ticket office at sincil bank will open today for a special football train which will travel to the capital on saturday loaded with fans .
supporters will also be able to collect pre-paid tickets for the match today .
meanwhile , tonight the imps are away at braintree in the national league .
author: Rob Makepeace
BBC Radio Lincolnshire sport

documents.title: new free school proposed for grimsby
text: a new primary school could be built in scartho .
the healing multi-academy trust , which is working in conjunction with north east lincolnshire council , are asking the public what they think to their plans :
studies have demonstrated that scartho needs more primary places and this demand will increase because of the numbers of new houses being built , or planned , over the next few years . ''
a drop-in session has been organised on the morning of friday 17 march at scartho community library .

documents.title: raf fighters sent to intercept civilian jet
text: the mod 's confirmed in the last few minutes that typhoon aircraft from a lincolnshire raf station escorted a civilian jet into birmingham airport .
it 's thought the plane , which had taken off from the romanian capital bucharest , had lost communications with the ground , when the jets from raf coningsby were launched .

the royal air force can confirm that typhoon aircraft from raf coningsby , lincs were launched this morning by quick reaction alert mission to intercept a civilian aircraft that had lost communications .
the aircraft was safely escorted to birmingham international airport . ''

documents.title: hundreds still without water after main burst
text: people living in the lincolnshire wolds are still experiencing problems with their water this morning .
a burst main under the river bain on sunday left a thousand residents in the tetford and binbrook area without water .
some homes were restored with a low-pressure supply last night but others are still without .
anglian water provided bottled water yesterday - but some villagers say they did n't get them until late afternoon .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Lincolnshire Live

but there are tailbacks on the a16 to algarkirk .

text: the christmas tree festival is coming back to st wulfram 's church this december - but with a difference .

father stuart craddock is the vicar behind it , this is what happened when he tried to show off the rink last time :
ouch .
father craddock says events like these are helping the church to become a community hub in grantham :
it 's really important to us that st wulfram 's is thrust back into the centre of the community .
it always was historically and we want to recapture that , allow people to come in on their own terms and explore the space .

for people that ca n't get out we will deliver house to house so it 's important that they let us know .
in a large rural area like this we will try and put water in a number of places that are convenient . ''
